name: Haroseth With Chestnuts, Pine Nuts, Pears and Dried Fruits
description: Haroseth was served for Passover at Seders in Roman times, if not earlier, and versions exist all over the world, adapted for the fruits and nuts available. This recipe from Italy contains no spices, relying instead on a vibrant mix of fresh and dried fruit for flavor — so use the ripest and sweetest you can find.
keywords: almond, apple, banana, chestnut, dates, figs, kosher red wine, pear, pine nuts, prune, side dish, vegan, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup kosher for Passover wine or grape juice, or as needed
Juice and grated rind of 1/2 lemon

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium pot, combine all ingredients except for the chestnuts and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until fruit starts to break down, about 30 minutes. Stir in chestnuts.
Transfer to a food processor and pulse in short bursts until chunky, or until desired texture is reached.
